name: uncovered
content:
uncovered adjective
(NO COVER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
without a cover or covering on it: The child fell down the uncovered drain while playing on a building site near his home. The sun was beating down on her uncovered head and she needed to move into the shade.
More examplesFewer examplesMicrowave on High for 30 seconds in a small, uncovered microwave-safe bowl.There is a simple solution if you are caught in a survival situation without any sun protection: smear any uncovered skin in mud.Snow reflects up to 80 percent of the sun's rays, which can cause sunburn and damage to uncovered skin.The workers noted many gulls around, attracted to uncovered bins full of waste food.

uncovered adjective
(NO INSURANCE)
not protected by insurance (= an agreement in which you pay a company money and they pay your costs if you have an accident, injury, etc.): That year agriculture companies and farmers faced at least £3.6 billion in uncovered losses due to natural disasters.
More examplesFewer examplesInsurance won't pay any uncovered losses because that would mean there could be insufficient funds to pay claims for which premiums were paid.
